summary: This is a discovery and Brady material request letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen & Gresser LLP) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter outlines numerous specific requests for evidence, witness information, and documents related to the criminal case against Maxwell, including materials about the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein, minor victims, and various attorneys involved.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of Cohen & Gresser LLP, the subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330 (AJN)), for whom the defense is requesting extensive discovery and Brady material.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced as the individual who signed the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement; the alleged sexual abuse by him is central to the case against Maxwell.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the discovery request letter on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Listed as one of the 'Attorneys' representing individuals alleging abuse, whose communications with prosecutors are requested.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in relation to Epstein's alleged sexual abuse; the defense requests materials about their communications and the NPA Epstein signed.
Everdell is an attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP writing this discovery request on behalf of client Maxwell.
Both are listed among the 'Attorneys' representing alleged victims, whose collective communications with prosecutors are requested.
The indictment identifies Minor Victims 1-3; Maxwell's defense seeks extensive records about them.
The defense requests records of communications and payments between Epstein and the minor victims.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein signs Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with federal prosecutors, a central subject of the defense's discovery requests.

events.title: Attorneys meet with SDNY prosecutors
events.description: Certain attorneys for alleged victims met with SDNY prosecutors to request a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: SDNY investigation begins
events.description: The government asserts it began the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Government's recent production
events.description: The government made a production of documents on October 2, 2020, which the defense is still reviewing.

locations: United States Attorney's Office Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022
Southern District of Florida (referenced for prior Epstein investigation)
keyFacts: The defense is seeking all communications and documents related to the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement signed by Jeffrey Epstein, including unredacted emails between government prosecutors and Epstein's attorneys.
The defense requests the identities and complete birthdays of the individuals identified in the indictment as 'Minor Victims 1-3' and extensive personal records on them and any other alleged victims.
The letter references a 2016 meeting where victim attorneys asked the SDNY to investigate Epstein and Maxwell, and a separate FBI investigation into an unnamed individual for obstruction of justice.
The defense seeks materials from the prior Southern District of Florida investigation, including an '82-page pros memo and 53-page indictment'.
The letter outlines broad Brady requests for exculpatory and impeachment evidence, including evidence about witness credibility, financial motives, and misconduct by government agents.
